summary: The Public Safety Officers' Benefits program pays public safety officers or their families if the officers are permanently disabled or killed in the line of duty. Since 2020, some officers who died from COVID-19 or by suicide became eligible for the program—nearly doubling the number of claims received. This compounded ongoing problems with claims processing. title: Public Safety Officers' Benefits Program: Transparency, Claims Assistance, and Program Management Improvements Needed
